title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A timeless novel about racial injustice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling portrayal of a totalitarian society under constant surveillance, where independent thought is a crime.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty and romantic tale of manners and misunderstandings in 19th-century England, centered around Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A poignant story of wealth, love, and the American Dream, told through the mysterious figure of Jay Gatsby.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A classic coming-of-age story following Holden Caulfield as he grapples with adolescence and alienation in post-war America.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected adventure in this beloved prelude to The Lord of the Rings.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A haunting tale of censorship and resistance in a future where books are outlawed and burned.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: An orphaned girl becomes a governess and falls in love with her brooding employer, Mr. Rochester, in this Gothic romance.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest to kill the white whale is a seafaring epic of obsession and revenge.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping narrative of love, war, and society in Russia during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: The epic journey of Odysseus as he attempts to return home from the Trojan War, encountering mythical creatures along the way.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of guilt and redemption as Raskolnikov grapples with his crime.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian future where individuality and emotion are suppressed in favor of state control and conformity.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tragic tale of passion and vengeance set on the bleak Yorkshire moors.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: An exploration of faith, doubt, and free will in a Russian family torn apart by murder.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The comedic and philosophical adventures of a man who believes he is a knight-errant in a world that has forgotten chivalry.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A sweeping tale of redemption, revolution, and the human spirit in 19th-century France.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: Victor Frankenstein creates life, only to face the horrifying consequences of his ambition.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The legendary vampire Count Dracula attempts to spread the undead curse in Victorian England.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic love story that unfolds amid the complexities of Russian high society.
